fields.name: multiplier
fields.description: This is to normalise the range, so we might put in 100 for armour, if we expect that to be the maximum amount

fields.description: the parameter that is of interest (remember that omitted ones don't influence the effect up/down

fields.name: template
fields.description: the template this will be a part of

fields.name: weighting
fields.description: How much we care about the parameter

fields.name: factor_bias
fields.description: This is how much we multiply the total score by to find a resulting score. This is for an overall balance for each template, so that we can tweak a template to be used fore / less frequently

fields.name: skeleton
fields.description: This creates an AGF dependency.

fields.name: attack
fields.description: Attack = ramp up, Decay = drop to sustain level, Sustain = plateau, release = ramp off.  Image search for ADSR envelope online for a visual representation of the attack,decay,sustain,release curve. Attack is the ramp up of camera shake (time in seconds).

fields.name: decay
fields.description: Attack = ramp up, Decay = drop to sustain level, Sustain = plateau, release = ramp off.  Image search for ADSR envelope online for a visual representation of the attack,decay,sustain,release curve.  Decay is the drop from the attack height to the sustain height (time in seconds).

fields.name: fall_off_distance
fields.description: Distance, in metres, from the camera shake position, that the camera shake drops to zero.

fields.name: horizontal_amplitude
fields.description: Horizontal movement amplitude of the camera

fields.name: horizontal_frequency
fields.description: Horizontal movement frequency of the camera

fields.name: octave_amplitude_multiplier
fields.description: This is an overall master controller for the amplitude of the noise used in the camera shake.   This is a multiplier which is applied to all of the amplitude controls in the table.

fields.name: octave_frequency_multiplier
fields.description: This is an overall master controller for the frequency of the noise used in the camera shake.    This is a multiplier which is applied to all of the frequency controls in the table.

fields.name: octaves
fields.description: Octaves controls the levels of noise applied to the camera shake.   Each layer is higher in frequency and with less amplitude than the previous layer.   Each new layer will add more expense to the setup.

fields.name: pitch_amplitude
fields.description: Rotation amplitude around the horizontal axis of the camera.  Image search for 'roll pitch yaw' for a diagram.

fields.name: pitch_frequency
fields.description: Rotation frequency around the horizontal axis of the camera.  Image search for 'roll pitch yaw' for a diagram.

fields.name: release
fields.description: Attack = ramp up, Decay = drop to sustain level, Sustain = plateau, release = ramp off. Image search for ADSR envelope online for a visual representation of the attack,decay,sustain,release curve.  Release is the ramp off of camera shake (time in seconds).

fields.name: roll_amplitude
fields.description: Rotation amplitude around the axis the camera is pointing in.   Image search for 'roll pitch yaw' for a diagram.

fields.name: roll_frequency
fields.description: Rotation frequency around the axis the camera is pointing in.  Image search for 'roll pitch yaw' for a diagram.

fields.name: sustain
fields.description: Attack = ramp up, Decay = drop to sustain level, Sustain = plateau, release = ramp off. Image search for ADSR envelopse online for a visual representation of the curve. Sustain is the plateau of camera shake (time in seconds).

fields.name: sustain_multiplier
fields.description: The sustain multiplier is a proportion of the maximum attack value on the curve.   So, if the maximum attack value reaches 2.5 and the sustain multiplier is 0.5, then the sustain value is 1.25.  Image search for ADSR envelope online for a visual representation of the attack,decay,sustain,release curve.

fields.name: vertical_amplitude
fields.description: Verticall movement amplitude of the camera

fields.name: vertical_frequency
fields.description: Verticall movement frequency of the camera

fields.name: yaw_amplitude
fields.description: Rotation amplitude around the vertical axis of the camera, like on a tripod. Image search for 'roll pitch yaw' for a diagram.

fields.name: yaw_frequency
fields.description: Rotation frequency around the vertical axis of the camera, like on a tripod. Image search for 'roll pitch yaw' for a diagram.

fields.name: required_tile_upgrades
fields.description: A semi-colon separated list of tile upgrades required to for this entry to be used.

fields.name: battle_type_override
fields.description: Changes the battle type provided by the campaign model before any catchment is selected. This will become the new battle type that will be faught. The Area name must be the same as the Group name for this override to work

fields.name: catchment_name
fields.description: which subcatchment to choose, or empty for none, * for any.

fields.name: is_alliance_based
fields.description: Determines if the modifier will work at alliance or army level

fields.name: modifier_value
fields.description: Value that will be used by the modifier for performing any value modification

fields.name: unitary_delta_value
fields.description: Value to be added to modifier_value whenever the reference unit count (number of capture points, for instance) surpasses the threshold value. The value will be added x times following the formula: x = reference_units_count - threshold

fields.name: currency_type
fields.description: if left blank, the modifier will affect all currencies

fields.name: item_type
fields.description: if left blank, the modifier will affect all items

fields.name: currency_type
fields.description: if left blank, the modifier will affect all currencies

fields.name: item_type
fields.description: if left blank, the modifier will affect all items

fields.name: flying_charge_speed

fields.name: size
fields.description: Size of entity for collision priority and combat

fields.name: gradient_strategy

fields.name: combat_reaction_radius

fields.name: hit_reactions_ignore_chance

fields.name: max_tracking_ratio

fields.name: dismember_arms_alive_hp_ratio

fields.description: Percentage chance of performing jump attack (0..100)

fields.name: dealt_collision_knocked_down_threshold_multiplier

fields.description: Multiplier for the collision speed delta threshold to apply to the victim of the collision

fields.name: force_initial_turn_angle

fields.name: max_standing_turn_speed

fields.name: min_stopping_distance

fields.name: min_turn_to_move_distance
fields.description: (unused) Minimum distance to target at which turning while moving can be activated.

fields.name: precise_distance

fields.name: precise_movement_completion_distance

fields.name: engine_crew_max_turn_delta

fields.name: engine_crew_bearing_tolerance

fields.name: autonomous_rider_can_shoot_in_melee
fields.description: If this is true, and the entity is an autonomous rider, the entity can shoot while the mount is charging or in melee. If false, the rider always sync with the mount for melee actions.

fields.name: autonomous_rider_hero
fields.description: If this is true, and the entity is an autonomous rider, the entity will assume the uniform of the agent from the campaign map

fields.description: Determines if the source type will be managed at alliance or army level

fields.description: A custom environment to load

fields.name: battle_name

fields.description: The lua script to load for this battle

fields.name: battlefield_folder

fields.description: The campaign representation of the character

fields.name: script_name
fields.description: The script_name of the unit (used by lua and generated_battle)

fields.name: number_of_unit
fields.description: The number of this unit in the army

fields.name: key
fields.description: Unique id

fields.name: sort_order
fields.description: Sort order for display in frontend, lower the closer to the top (so 0, 1, 2)

fields.name: campaign_map
fields.description: Links to index field from the campaign_map_playable_areas table so correct map can be used in frontend

fields.name: head_tracking_angle
fields.description: Maximum head tracking angle (degrees)

fields.name: filter_projectiles_node
fields.description: Fill in prefixes of all bone chain roots that should be filtered for projectile sticking

fields.name: torso_splice_node
fields.description: If this is filled, it overrides the 'default' bone used for torso splicing. The 'default' is currently spine for bipeds and neck for quadruped.

fields.name: foot_ik_type
fields.description: Enable automatic projection of feet out of the ground using IK.

fields.name: sort_order
fields.description: Order put in ui

fields.description: Ratio of funds defender gets as opposed to attacker for this battle type

fields.name: max_teamsize
fields.description: Maximum number of armies per alliance for this battle type

fields.name: timeout_winner_is_attacker
fields.description: By default defender wins on timeout, we flip that for this battle type

fields.name: attacker_decision_condition
fields.description: When the condition succeeds we send a message, via UI we can decide if finish battle early

fields.name: defender_decision_condition
fields.description: When the condition succeeds we send a message, via UI we can decide if finish battle early

fields.name: max_unit_cap
fields.description: Number of units can control at a time once in battle (with unit sharing, reinforcements)

fields.name: reinforcement_pool_cap
fields.description: Size of the reinforcement pool can setup in the lobby

fields.name: starting_unit_cap
fields.description: Number of units can control at start of battle (so how many can recruit in the lobby)

fields.name: team_size
fields.description: Team size (number of players in alliance) these caps used for

fields.name: addition_to_max_for_first_player
fields.description: To allow tweaks to first players count for situations where max is odd value and want total of alliance to be even

fields.name: budget_multiplier
fields.description: Funds multiplied by this multiplier so can change funds available based on team size

fields.name: change_max_angle
fields.description: Determines the maximum angle for the random change in direction of travel. Max is 360 degrees. 0 means that angle will never be changed.

fields.name: contact_effect
fields.description: If the vortex hits an entity, this ‘special_ability_phase’ will be applied on their unit.

fields.name: damage
fields.description: base damage dealt by the vortex at 100% damage scaling. Damage scales linearly towards the edge of the vortex radius.

fields.name: damage_ap
fields.description: armour-piercing damage dealt by the vortex at 100% damage scaling.

fields.name: duration
fields.description: Determines how long a vortex explosion will last in seconds.

fields.name: expansion_speed
fields.description: Determines the rate of expansion for the vortex. This value is per second. Expansion speed is also multiplied with ‘detonation_force’ to calculate momentum for impacts (knock back, knocked down, knocked flying). Note, vortices can have negative expansion speed, which will drag entities towards the centre of the vortex. If you use a negative expansion speed, start and goal radius need to be the same.

fields.name: goal_radius
fields.description: Determines the ultimate radius for the vortex. The vortex explosion will expand per second according to the ‘expansion_speed’ until goal radius is reached.

fields.name: infinite_height
fields.description: if set to yes the vortex will become a cylinder with infinite height rather than a globe.

fields.name: move_change_freq
fields.description: Determines how frequently the vortex movement will change direction of travel. This represents seconds.

fields.name: movement_speed
fields.description: Determines whether the centre of the vortex will move and a what speed. If movement_speed is 0, the vortex will stay static. This speed is meters per second.

fields.name: start_radius
fields.description: Determines the starting radius for the vortex. This is in meters.

fields.name: ignition_amount

fields.name: goal_evaluations
fields.description: Number of diplomacy goal evaluations this personality is allowed per turn. The actual amount is as follows: An intermediary value is formed as max(CAI variable max_goal_evalautions_per_faction, CAI variable max_goal_evalautions_per_round / alive non-rebel factions). If the field use_minimum_for_goal_evaluations is ticked, the final value is min(intermediary, goal_evaluations). Otherwise it is max(intermediary, goal_evaluations). localised_fields.name: description
localised_fields.description: Text that appears in tooltip when mousing over ground of this type

fields.name: ground_type
fields.description: Ground type to use for the texture group.

fields.name: texture_group
fields.description: The name of a terrain texture group.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Is this index record enabled? If false, it won't be shown.

fields.name: generate
fields.description: Should the incident generate randomly? Set to false if triggering the incident via script.

fields.name: prioritised
fields.description: Set to true to bypass any turn restrictions or chance restrictions. Won't have any effect if "generate" is set to false!

fields.name: effects
fields.description: Provided effects distributed directly from the object. "EFFECT BUNDLE IS NOT APPLIED TO THE EFFECT BUNDLES_LIST"

fields.name: active_initiative_limit
fields.description: Maximum number of initiatives that can be active in this set at the same time. Negative means infinite.

fields.name: training_level
fields.description: Deprecated. Field should always be set to "Trained" - BL

fields.name: reload
fields.description: Percentage reduction of projectile reload time

fields.name: hiding_scalar
fields.description: This affects the range that the unit can be spotted at, less than 1 makes it longer, greater than 1 shorter. So 1.5 would increase the spotters range by +50%

fields.name: damage_mod_flame
fields.description: How much we modify flaming damage, 0 is unaffected, -100 is double damage, +100 is negation

fields.name: damage_mod_magic
fields.description: How much we modify magical damage, 0 is unaffected, -100 is double damage, +100 is negation

fields.name: damage_mod_physical
fields.description: How much we modify physical damage, 0 is unaffected, -100 is double damage, +100 is negation

fields.name: damage_mod_missile
fields.description: How much we modify missile damage, 0 is unaffected, -100 is double damage, +100 is negation

fields.name: damage_mod_all
fields.description: How much we modify all damage, 0 is unaffected, -100 is double damage, +100 is negation

fields.name: ai_usage_group
fields.description: How should the ai use this unit in battle?

fields.name: can_skirmish
fields.description: draughts needs mounting with man_entity.

fields.name: can_brace
fields.description: Indicates units capable of bracing

fields.name: mounted_draughts
fields.description: draughts needs mounting with man_entity.

fields.name: sync_locomotion
fields.description: Check this to force synchronised walk, run, charge animation.

fields.name: harmony_amplification_type
fields.description: Use this to make a unit a harmony amplifie. Needs to have encourage attribute to work!

fields.name: first_person
fields.description: First person firing information

localised_fields.name: concealed_name
localised_fields.description: This name is used in battle for enemy units when it is present (for goblin fanatics for example will show them as regular goblins, but want player who has these units to tell difference)

fields.name: articulation_node_1_offset
fields.description: distance from front of model. place this at the draught entity connector to the beam to prevent draughts moving outside of beam when turning

fields.name: articulation_node_1_radius
fields.description: size of node 1. do not let node circles overlap.

fields.name: articulation_node_2_offset
fields.description: distance from front of model. should be at location of beam joint of chariot

fields.name: articulation_node_2_radius
fields.description: size of node 2. do not let node circles overlap.

fields.name: articulation_node_3_offset
fields.description: distance from front of model. will prevent node 1 from ever overlapping with node 3, but this should already be limited by the angle.

fields.name: articulation_node_3_radius
fields.description: size of node 3. do not let node circles overlap.

fields.name: articulation_max_angle
fields.description: left and right angle, measured from node 2 facing forwards

fields.name: head_offset
fields.description: Offset of soft collision centre, positve numbers move it backwards from centre of beam

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image to display

localised_fields.name: bulletpoints
localised_fields.description: Bullet point text, split bullet points with ||

localised_fields.name: description
localised_fields.description: Description text shown under bullet points

fields.name: caste
fields.description: Among other usages, caste allows the overriding of UI stat bar max values

fields.name: in_encyclopedia
fields.description: Generally, this is the case. However some units (mainly bastions) are not in the encyclopaedia and the code will look up the redirects table

fields.name: ui_unit_group_land
fields.description: This is used for category icon on unit when on land

fields.name: tier
fields.description: Tier, only used in ui to show level of unit

fields.name: is_high_threat
fields.description: High threat units override the entity threshold checks of melee reactions. If they run into or attack a unit, the unit will instantly react, even if less than 25% of their entities are affected.

fields.name: porthole_composite_scene
fields.description: Full path of composite scene to use for porthole in battle (optional, if empty will just render unit from battle. Only required for special circumstances like chariots)

fields.name: melee_cp
fields.description: Base Melee Combat Potential of this unit. Must be >= 0.0 or the game will crash on startup. This value is modified (increased) by other factors such as Rank and equipped Abilities / Items. Reduced by 20% for missile cav.

fields.name: missile_cp
fields.description: Base Missile Combat Potential of this unit. Must be >= 0.0 or the game will crash on startup. This value is modified (increased) by other factors such as Rank and equipped Abilities / Items. Reduced by 20% for missile cav.

fields.name: can_siege
fields.description: If true, can attack the turn a settlement is besieged - do not need to wait to build siege equipment on the campaign map

fields.name: is_monstrous
fields.description: For voiceover : Is this unit regarded as monstrous?

fields.name: multiplayer_qb_cap
fields.description: Multiplayer cap for quest battles, requested by Alisdair

fields.name: vo_is_dragon
fields.description: For voiceover : Is this unit regarded as a dragon?

fields.name: vo_is_dinosaur
fields.description: For voiceover : Is this unit regarded as a dinosaur?

fields.name: bonus_v_large
fields.description: Will trigger against anything that is not Inf, not only large!

fields.name: weapon_length
fields.description: Relevant for pikes, cav refusal distances and close proximity. The latter picks between this and 1m + entity radius, whatever is longer, to determine weapon "reach". Chariot riders use this to check if enemies are within reach.

fields.name: splash_attack_target_size
fields.description: Do splash attacks when fighting up to this size

fields.name: splash_attack_max_attacks
fields.description: Maximum entities to attack per splash attack animation. Note that High Priority targets (main units table) allways get treated focussed damage.

fields.name: splash_attack_power_multiplier
fields.description: Multiplier to knock power in splash attack metadata

fields.name: building_damage_multiplier
fields.description: Damage multiplier applied when hitting buildings

fields.name: ignition_amount
fields.description: How much do we contribute towards ignition. Also, use to determine as being flaming for context

fields.name: is_magical
fields.description: Is this weapon considered magical

fields.name: contact_phase
fields.description: Do we cause a phase effect to the targets unit on hit

fields.name: collision_attack_max_targets
fields.description: Maximum targets damaged by collision attack. This cap is refreshed by collision_attack_max_targets_cooldown.

fields.name: collision_attack_max_targets_cooldown
fields.description: Each second, this amount of targets will be removed from the max targets list, enabling the collision attacker to deal more attacks.

fields.name: melee_attack_interval
fields.description: Min interval between the start of each attack animation

fields.name: scaling_damage
fields.description: If damage calculation has to be scaled based on different rules

fields.name: is_spell
fields.description: Is our context 'spell'

fields.name: priority
fields.description: Messages with a higher priority will be opened over those with a lower priority. 100 is standard for all messages.

fields.name: flag_model_skin_override
fields.description: Use to change model used for campaign flags for this army type (for exmaple used on wh3 caravans). Refers to folder in ui/3dui/models

fields.name: x_coordinate
fields.description: 0 is middle

fields.name: y_coordinate
fields.description: 0 is top

fields.name: generate
fields.description: Should the mission generate randomly? Set to false if triggering the mission via script.

fields.name: prioritised
fields.description: Set to true to bypass any turn restrictions or chance restrictions. Won't have any effect if "generate" is set to false!

fields.name: location_x
fields.description: Display coordinates, not logical

fields.name: location_y
fields.description: Display coordinates, not logical

fields.name: quest_character
fields.description: this is the character ID from the start_pos_characters table

fields.name: localised_mission_completed_text
fields.default_value: Success! You have achieved one of your goals.

fields.name: logic_file_override
fields.description: Override the Logic File?

fields.name: collision_file_override
fields.description: Override the Collision File?

fields.name: collision_file
fields.description: override the tech with a collision tech file

fields.name: general_pct
fields.description: How much of funds to spend on general

fields.name: key
fields.description: Unique id

fields.name: units_pct
fields.description: How much of funds to spend on units

fields.name: upgrade_pct
fields.description: How much of funds to spend on upgrades

fields.name: ignition_threshold
fields.description: This value indicates how many incendiary points are required before the ship will set on fire and start taking damage.

fields.name: is_primary_unit_attack
fields.description: If true then this is the unit's primary attack

fields.name: has_persistent_factors
fields.description: If true, the income/expenditure breakdown will not be reset when regular income is applied

fields.name: minimum
fields.description: This is the minimum capacity of the factor - so a value of 0 means the factor can never be negative!

fields.name: fuse_distance_from_target
fields.description: This will activate the explosion n metres from target. If n is greater than distance to target, then the explosion will occur instantly when the projectile is activated. To get beyond this, add a min_range to the projectile.

fields.name: ignition_amount
fields.description: How much this explosion contributes towards causing ignition. Also, this determines it being flaming as a context

fields.name: is_magical
fields.description: Is our context 'magical'

fields.name: detonation_damage_ap
fields.description: How much armour penetration damage this causes per entity hit

fields.name: detonation_force
fields.description: This is how much force is applied to determine the result of being hit, for knockbacks etc.

fields.name: fuse_fixed_time
fields.description: Fixed fuse time in s. -1 means not fixed. Use EITHER fixed fuse time or distance from target

fields.name: is_spell
fields.description: Is the damage affected by spell resistance

fields.name: max_damage_multiplier
fields.description: This is the damage dealt at max health ratio, e.g. at full health

fields.name: max_health_ratio
fields.description: Upper ratio for health for scaling

fields.name: min_damage_multiplier
fields.description: This is the damage dealt at min health ratio

fields.name: min_health_ratio
fields.description: Ratio for minimum health left for scaling

fields.name: category
fields.description: some categories like artillery and misc ignore shields. Artillery also has a separate morale penalty.

fields.name: projectile_number
fields.description: how many projectiles are launched per fire pos/launch.

fields.name: max_elevation
fields.description: This is the maximum angle that the projectile can be fired at. Generally you want it high (max 90 degrees), and above 45. Except for special cases (e.g. cannon). Not used when trajectory is fixed!

fields.name: muzzle_velocity
fields.description: This describes the speed the projectile launches at (metres per second). If it is negative, the code will calculate this value based on firing at 45 degrees, hitting at the effective range. Not used when trajectory is fixed!

fields.name: marksmanship_bonus
fields.description: Bonus to accuracy inherent to projectile. Reduces size of calibration area together with a land_units accuracy stat.

fields.name: collision_radius
fields.description: Used to calculate whether a projectile collides with a building.

fields.name: calibration_distance
fields.description: The distance at which the calibration area is at 100%.

fields.name: calibration_area
fields.description: The area within which the projectile can land when fired. Scales according to calibration distance and is reduced further by accuracy and marksmanship bonus.

fields.name: bonus_v_infantry
fields.description: deals extra damage to entities that are small or very small. This bonus damage used the armour-piercing ration of the total projectile damage.

fields.name: bonus_v_large
fields.description: deals extra damage to entities that are medium or larger. This bonus damage used the armour-piercing ration of the total projectile damage.

fields.name: overhead_stat_effect
fields.description: Apply this special ability phase when projectile travels over a unit.

fields.name: shockwave_radius
fields.description: Determines radius around the projectile where damage will still be dealt. Allows near misses to still deal damage.

fields.name: contact_stat_effect
fields.description: Apply this special ability phase when projectile hits a unit.

fields.name: gravity
fields.description: Use this value to make projectiles be more / less affected by gravity. This is mainly used as a representation of wind resistance, so that projectiels can hang in the air. Negative means to use 'normal' gravity.

fields.name: burst_size
fields.description: Number of shots in a single burst (value of 1 means no burst mode)

fields.name: burst_shot_delay
fields.description: Determines the delay between each shot of the same burst

fields.name: mass
fields.description: Mass of the projectile.

fields.name: homing_params
fields.description: Link to projectile_homing_params table.

fields.name: ignition_amount
fields.description: How much do we contribute to setting things on fire. Also, if this value is greater than 0, this is considered a flaming attack

fields.name: is_magical
fields.description: Are we considered magical, for contextual reasons

fields.name: can_target_airborne
fields.description: Can this projectile target a flying unit

fields.name: fixed_elevation
fields.description: Elevation of fixed trajectory

fields.name: expiry_range
fields.description: If this value is positive it dictactes the maximum distance a projectile can travel before it expires

fields.name: is_beam_launch_burst
fields.description: Launch beams will attempt to make the vfx match the projectiles travel, and apply a clipping plane when a projectile hits something, culling the projectiles in front

fields.name: expire_on_impact
fields.description: If true, the projectile will expire on impact, and will not stick into, or deflect off the object it hit

fields.name: can_roll
fields.description: Can the projectile roll on the ground

fields.name: trail_always_on
fields.description: If this flag is on, then the trail will always get displayed, regardless of the UI preference for showing projectile trails

fields.name: shots_per_volley
fields.description: Usually units shoot 1 hot per volley, but some animations have multiple fire points, such as multi-shot artillery units. Most of the logic isn't aware of this, so this field is for reference for those systems

fields.name: fired_by_mount
fields.description: If this flag is on (and the firing entity is a macro entity) the mount will fire, rather than the rider

fields.name: lock_on_multiple_fire_pos
fields.description: When this is true, all fire positions in an animation will aim at the original position of the target, otherwise they will track the target position

fields.name: prefer_central_targets
fields.description: Prefer entities nearer the centre of the target (rather than closest in firing arc)

fields.name: building_damage_multiplier
fields.description: Damage multiplier applied when hitting buildings or vehicles

fields.name: scaling_damage
fields.description: If damage calculation has to be scaled based on different rules

fields.name: is_spell
fields.description: Is the damage affected by spell resistance!

fields.name: arrival_window
fields.description: The time (seconds) duration that any of the projectiles can appear

fields.name: num_projectiles
fields.description: The total number of projectiles that will spawn. Their arrival times are random, within the times specified

fields.name: projectile_type
fields.description: This is the projectile that will spawn

fields.name: radius_spread
fields.description: How far away from the target this can theoretically land

fields.name: start_time
fields.description: the minimum time (seconds) that must pass before a projectile can appear

fields.name: launch_source
fields.description: The suggested starting location of the bombardment

fields.name: display_model
fields.description: Rigid model.

fields.name: impact
fields.description: Link to projectile impacts table.

fields.name: launch_fx
fields.description: One-shot VFX when projectile is launched.

fields.name: trail_fx
fields.description: Tracking VFX when projectile is in flight.

fields.name: stationary_fx
fields.description: Tracking VFX when projectile is stuck to something.

fields.name: airborne_anim
fields.description: For weighted mesh, animation to play when in flight.

fields.name: landing_anim
fields.description: For weighted mesh, animation to play when landing and bouncing.

fields.name: tip_offset
fields.description: Offset applied to model to make the projectile tip stick accurately.

fields.name: impact_bounce
fields.description: For bouncing vfx

fields.name: impact_penetrate
fields.description: For penetration vfx

fields.name: impact_blood
fields.description: Blood pack version for impact vfx

fields.name: impact_bounce_blood
fields.description: Blood pack version for impact bounce vfx

fields.name: impact_penetrate_blood
fields.description: Blood pack version for impact penetrate vfx

fields.name: mirroring_start
fields.description: Triggered when the projectile mirroring starts

fields.name: mirroring_trail
fields.description: Trail to use when the missile is mirroring

fields.name: angular_velocity_decay
fields.description: Reduces the turning of the projectile after the player stopped turning it (a bit like fake air resistance)

fields.name: camera_y_offset
fields.description: Cam height

fields.name: camera_z_offset
fields.description: Cam distance from projectile

fields.name: drag_coefficent
fields.description: Air resistance. In combination with gravity, launch speed, lift and tail, this gives you control over the max range of the projectile. Values around 0.002 are good for the Doomdiver.

fields.name: impact_view_distance
fields.description: Impact cam distance

fields.name: impact_view_elevation
fields.description: Impact cam height

fields.name: impact_view_time
fields.description: How long the impact cam shows the impact position

fields.name: invert_pitch_control
fields.description: Inverted controls move the projectile up when moving the mouse downwards

fields.name: lift_coefficent
fields.description: higher values = easier to keep velocity and gain height

fields.name: tail_coefficent
fields.description: higher values = increase resistance against the lift

fields.name: lookahead_time
fields.description: Time to look ahead to predict future position of target (intercept vs pursuit).

fields.name: max_target_angle_delta
fields.description: If target angle delta is greater than this threshold, stop homing.

fields.name: start_time
fields.description: Time after launch to start homing.

fields.name: steering_coefficient
fields.description: Multiplier to muzzle speed to get velocity correction per second.

fields.name: description
fields.description: User description.

fields.name: entity_size_cap
fields.description: Size of entity that will stop this projectile immediately.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Unique key.

fields.name: max_penetration
fields.description: Penetration stat. A higher number means this projectile passes through more penetration points before being stopped. Check the battle entities table to see how many penetration points a single entity has.

fields.name: icon_name
fields.description: The icon to use in ui/battle ui/ability icons for this ability button

fields.name: battle_key
fields.description: Key in battles table (if this is a battle)

fields.name: campaign_key
fields.description: Key in campaigns table (if this is a campaign)

fields.name: is_battle
fields.description: Is chapter a battle or campaign

fields.name: number
fields.description: Chapter number

fields.name: banner
fields.description: Path to the chapter banner from working_data

fields.name: campaign_faction_key
fields.description: Optional faction to start as when loading a campaign

fields.name: default
fields.description: If true this provider will be used for displaying the code side contribution of this factor. Only one provider may be default per-factor

fields.name: faction_swapping_id
fields.description: Three digit code to swap faction prefabs

fields.name: self_payload
fields.description: Applied to the calling faction only

fields.name: force_faction_diplomatic_faction_set
fields.description: Diplomatic filter between the ritual performer and the target force

fields.name: region_ownership
fields.description: False == Only works in regions that are NOT owned by the target; True == Only works in regions that are owned by the target; Undefined == we don't evaluate ownership

fields.name: force_region_owner_diplomatic_faction_set
fields.description: Diplomatic filter between the ritual performer and the faction that owns the region the faction is in

fields.name: payload_base
fields.description: Allows you to attach a campaign payload to a ritual payload. Ideally we would replace this system completely, but we need to keep it working for legacy data.

fields.name: strength
fields.description: integer value for the storm strenght

fields.name: payload
fields.description: Name of the payload to trigger

fields.name: region
fields.description: target region for the storm

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key used by scriptors to trigger

fields.name: icon_path
fields.description: Optional path to icon to show with objective

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key for scriptors to trigger

fields.name: character_for_vo
fields.description: In-game character who will provide VO for this line, if any

fields.name: ui_icon_image
fields.description: UI icon to show on settlement

fields.name: ui_background_image
fields.description: UI background to show on settlement panel

fields.name: key
fields.description: Unique id, matches up to enum in code

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key that matches up to default_keys.xml

localised_fields.name: onscreen
localised_fields.description: Text shown in key options where can change them

localised_fields.name: toolitp
localised_fields.description: Optional tooltip shown when mousing over in controls options

fields.name: resource
fields.description: Available resource for this slot to show on ui

fields.name: permitted_units
fields.description: List of permitted units for this force. If null all units available to the faction will be permitted

fields.name: wind_up_aura_vfx
fields.description: This will attempt to override any 'ability aura' metadata in active animations

fields.name: wind_up_weapon_vfx
fields.description: This will attempt to override any 'ability weapon' metadata in active animations

fields.name: sort_order
fields.description: Determines sort order in custom battle screen. Lowest is furthest to left.

fields.name: is_naval
fields.description: Is ability for admirals?

fields.name: button_name
fields.description: This is lookup name for button images which essentially matches agent types,  used for lore selection buttons in battle

fields.name: is_composite_group
fields.description: If yes its a composite lore using abilities/spells from a bunch of other ability groups/lores. These are treated differently on the UI.

fields.name: sound_switch
fields.description: Sound switch to be used by the modular UI system

localised_fields.name: alt_description
localised_fields.description: Opposite text, as sometimes this can read better in UI to avoid double negatives

fields.name: cant_move
fields.description: Makes the unit unable to be given movement or attack orders (entities can still shoot, use abilities or react to melee).

fields.name: freeze_fatigue
fields.description: Makes the unit fatigue state 0 (=fresh) for duration of phase

fields.name: fatigue_change_ratio
fields.description: This is a scalar that changes the unit's fatigue (once off) relative to the maximum. For example, -0.25 will reduce it by 25% and 0.1 will increase it by 10%

fields.name: ability_recharge_change
fields.description: if the unit has abilities, their recharge will be changed by that amount (negative will reduce the time, positive will increase the time)

fields.name: hp_change_frequency
fields.description: In seconds, how often hp (hit point) change should attempt to be applied

fields.name: damage_amount
fields.description: Per entity, per frequency, what the amount of damage to apply. Note amounts under 4 do not work well on small unit sizes.

fields.name: max_damaged_entities
fields.description: Per damage/heal frequency, how many entities can we affect (negative is no limit)

fields.name: resurrect
fields.description: If ticked, when healing excess hit points will resurrect dead soldiers

fields.name: mana_regen_mod
fields.description: How much we add to the current recharge for mana per second

fields.name: mana_max_depletion_mod
fields.description: How much we add to the current value for max mana depletion

fields.name: imbue_magical
fields.description: Does this phase imbue the target with magical attacks?

fields.name: imbue_ignition
fields.description: Does this phase imbue the target with flaming attacks?

fields.name: imbue_contact
fields.description: Does this phase imbue the target with a contact phase when attacking?

fields.name: phase_display
fields.description: Add groups of visual effects

fields.name: is_hidden_in_ui
fields.description: If true, will not show up in UI

fields.name: replenish_ammo
fields.description: How much ammunition we want to replenish when phase starts (can be negative if we want to spend), this value is in percentage of unit max ammo

fields.name: composite_scene_group
fields.description: Composite scene group we need to trigger when the phase starts

fields.name: freeze_recharge
fields.description: Abilities on the target do not recharge while this phase is active

fields.name: heal_amount
fields.description: When HP (hit points) are healed, how much total should be changed, spread amoungst the entities

fields.name: attribute_type
fields.description: Positive means the affected will have the attribute, Negative means the affected will negate the attribute

fields.name: active_vfx
fields.description: Active vfx on the target is shown when phase is active

fields.name: banner_vfx
fields.description: Effect that plays around the base of the banner on all units affect by the phase

fields.name: entity_vfx
fields.description: The vfx to display on an entity level

fields.name: indent
fields.description: X - Rows Down (0>)

fields.name: tier
fields.description: Y - Columns In (0>)

fields.name: required_parents
fields.description: 0 implies all parents

fields.description: Offset in pixels in x for this technology

fields.name: pixel_offset_y
fields.description: Offset in pixels in y for this technology

fields.name: child_link_position

fields.name: travel_time

fields.name: position_x
fields.description: X coordinate of node position in hex space

fields.name: position_y

fields.name: idle_scene

fields.name: incoming_traveller_scene
fields.description: Scene shown at the node when a character is teleporting in

fields.name: close_scene
fields.description: One shot scene played when the node is closed

fields.name: open_scene
fields.description: One shot scene to play when the rift first opens

fields.name: sort_order
fields.description: Sort order in campaign select ui

fields.name: locked_team
fields.description: If not -1, will lock whoever playing this faction into this specific team

fields.name: prefab_path
fields.description: Prefab path relative to working_data

fields.name: settlement_gun_type
fields.description: Override gun when playing a settlement battle

fields.name: survival_gun_type
fields.description: Override gun when playing a survival battle

fields.name: growth_percentage
fields.description: Percentage 0-1

fields.name: max_unit_count_percentage
fields.description: Percentage 0-1

fields.name: key
fields.description: Old key that has been renamed

fields.name: patch_key
fields.description: Patch key to point to, should exist in the database

fields.name: can_player_set
fields.description: This is used to tell us which colours can be modified by a user

fields.name: game_area
fields.description: This is game area to pre-register for

fields.name: image_path
fields.description: This is the image path of image want to pre-register

fields.name: image_path
fields.description: Full image path to put in tags with this key

fields.name: key
